title: Strictly's Katya Jones wears wedding ring again after ex Neil 'heads home' with Alex Scott

Strictly Come Dancing 's Katya Jones was seen with her wedding ring back on.

The professional dancer slipped her band back onto her finger after pictures emerged of her ex Neil heading back to his dance partner Alex Scott's home.

Neil and Alex were spotted on Thursday night going into Alex's house together at 11pm, one month after he and Katya announced they were getting a divorce.

Then yesterday, Katya was pictured with her ring back on.

She was smiling as she left a hotel ahead of tonight's Strictly live show.

Dressed in a blue animal print coat, red leather skirt and a grey jumper, Katya held her hands outside of her coat so her wedding band was visible.

(Image: JTP Photographic)

(Image: JTP Photographic)

After leaving rehearsals together on Thursday, Neil and Alex headed back to her house where it's said they got glammed up for a date night.

Dancer Neil was in a smart suit, shirt and tie, while footballer Alex wore a long black skirt and jacket.

It's said Neil took Alex out to watch the International Ballroom Dancing Championships at London's Albert Hall.

And after the event ended, it's reported they went back to Alex's place together once more.

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

Neil and Katya announced their split last month with a joint statement.

It came 10 months after she was caught kissing her celeb partner, comedian Seann Walsh, and their representatives insisted that had nothing to do with their decision to end their marriage.

They said in a joint statement on Instagram : "After 11 years, we have made the mutual decision to separate.

"We will always love each other, just in a different way as friends. This will never change what a great team we make and we are really proud of everything we have achieved together.

(Image: Getty)

"Our shared love of dance means we will keep working and dancing together as well as exploring individual projects. No matter what we do we will always support and respect each other."

A spokesman for the couple then said: "It would be incorrect and unfair to attribute their separation to one isolated incident."

Mirror Online has contacted Katya, Neil and Alex's representatives for comment.
